sense.name: social rank, as in education or the military
sense.examples: Johnny is in the third grade this year. That school accommodates students from grades 9-12. What is the pay scale for that grade of army officer?

sense.name: an assigned value from a scale of values
sense.examples: Only lumber of the highest grade is used in our flooring materials. John got the lowest grade in the class on the chemistry exam. Their ranch only sells beef cattle that are grade. Mary managed to improve her grades last semester.

sense.name: the slope or inclination of a road or bank
sense.examples: I put the car into low gear because of the steep grade on the road. This stretch of road was built with a 7 percent grade.

sense.name: a degree of intensity
sense.examples: The doctor said her infection was only low grade. The level of pollen in the air today is medium grade. That grade of fire is hot enough to melt steel.

sense.name: being at ground level height
sense.examples: The base of the tower was well below grade. The windows of the basement were right at grade.

sense.name: 1/100th of a right angle
sense.examples: Two grades of a right angle would be equal to 1/50th of the angle.

sense.name: a series of alternate linguistic root forms
sense.examples: The historical linguist distinguished three types of root for this process of vowel alternation; full grade, reduced grade and zero grade.
